stem: A client with lung cancer presents with facial and neck edema, distended neck veins, and a 'full' feeling in the head. Symptoms worsen when he leans forward. Complete the bowtie to guide care.

actions.text: Place the client in a Trendelenburg position
Apply tight restrictive clothing to management edema
Prepare for emergent radiation therapy or stenting

rationale.correct: SVC syndrome is an oncologic emergency caused by compression of the SVC by a tumor. Facial edema and JVD are classic. Priority is reducing pressure (Positioning) and debulking the tumor (Radiation/Stent). Monitoring Focus: Airway (edema can spread) and Neuro (increased ICP from poor drainage).
rationale.incorrect: Restrictive clothing and Trendelenburg will worsen the venous congestion in the head and neck. Urine output and Calcium are not the primary monitoring points for SVC.
clinicalPearls: Stokes' sign (edema of the neck and face) is a hallmark of SVC syndrome.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the edema is strictly in the upper body (Face/Arms) and associated with malignancy, think SVC.

reviewUnits.heading: Superior Vena Cava â€” Pathophysiology & Recognition
reviewUnits.body: SVC syndrome is an oncologic emergency caused by compression of the SVC by a tumor. Facial edema and JVD are classic. Priority is reducing pressure (Positioning) and debulking the tumor (Radiation/Stent). Monitoring Focus: Airway (edema can spread) and Neuro (increased ICP from poor drainage). Stokes' sign (edema of the neck and face) is a hallmark of SVC syndrome.

reviewUnits.heading: Priority Interventions for Superior Vena Cava
reviewUnits.body: The priority nursing interventions are: Position the client in high-Fowler's; Prepare for emergent radiation therapy or stenting. Monitor: Neurological status and mental clarity; Airway patency and breathing effort. Restrictive clothing and Trendelenburg will worsen the venous congestion in the head and neck. Urine output and Calcium are not the primary monitoring points for SVC.
